channel.title: M. E. Mills
channel.description: Recent content on M. E. Mills

item.title: Edward Hallock Mills
item.description: Edward H. Mills was the patriarch of the family and a merchant, co-owning E. H. Mills & Co. in Cofu NY and owning E. H. Mills in Motts Corners/Brookton NY.

item.title: Historical Names
item.description: Brooktondale: from late 1700’s: Cantineville or Cantine’s Mill and a number of other variants. 1840: Mott’s Corners (often spelled Motts Corners) 1883: Brookton Feb 16, 1926: Brooktondale As a nod to Brooktondale’s history, several local businesses have adopted “Brookton” as part of their name, most notably Brookton’s Market. Brooktondale Road: Caroline Valley Community Church: Brookton’s Market:

item.title: Mills' Home in Brooktondale
item.description: The Mills Home in Brooktondale is located at present-day (2021) 475 Brooktondale Road. View largest available size. View largest available size. View largest available size.

item.title: E. H. Mills and M. E. Mills, Mott's Corners and Brookton
item.description: Upon moving to Mott’s Corners, Edward restarted E. H, Mills general store on his own, with his son Jonas working as clerk. Emily would eventually also work as clerk in the store, taking it over upon Edward’s death as M. E. Mills.

Esther Vorhis Sister +

item.title: Mary Emily Mills
item.description: Mary Emily Mills, better known as Emily, was owner of M. E. Mills general store in Brookton/Brooktondale NY. Known for her charity, Emily was a devoted member of the Congregational Church where she taught Sunday School and played piano. Emily was also active in local temperance organizations.

item.title: Temperance Activity
item.description: Temperance groups don't appear to be very strong here. The only mention I found was the "Royal Templars of Temperance" who began meeting in 1878. They didn't seem to be very powerful. No date was given as to when they ceased to exist. — Personal correspondence with Allan Starkweather, Corfu Village Historian — Apr 30, 1886 Quarterly Returns for Independent Order of Good Templars High Bridge Lodge No.

item.title: E. H. Mills & Co., Corfu NY
item.description: Not much is known of E. H. Mills & Co. of Corfu: The E.H. Mills General store was on the NE corner of Main and Allegheny in Corfu. It was open from 1866-1880. The building burned to the ground in a fire in 1899. It is now the site of the M&T Bank building. — May 20, 2021, Personal correspondence with Allan Starkweather, Corfu Village Historian E.

item.title: Ellen Gould
item.description: Mrs. Gould is keeping house for Miss Emily Mills. — 20 Mar 1917, The Ithaca Journal (Ithaca, NY), p7, newspapers.com View largest available size. Brookton Heights Brookton Heights, Dec. 13.—The L. A. C. of the Baptist Church and the L. A. C. of the Congregational Church will join forces to do Red Cross work Wednesday afternoon, Dec. 19. The meeting will be held at the home of Mrs. Charles Mulks.
